intro: Bonamia semidigyna var. semidigyna, commonly known as the narrowleaf bonamia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
